name: Practice Makes Perfect
trigger: You or an ally within range fails a skill check for a skill in which you or they are trained.
details: The target gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +3 bonus if the target has master or better proficiency in the skill. This bonus can change the outcome of the target's check.

pf2t.name: Practice Makes Perfect
pf2t.source: 148 Fires of the Haunted City pg. 65
pf2t.body:
**Trigger** You or an ally within range fails a skill check for a skill in which you or they are trained.

- - -

The target gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +3 bonus if the target has master or better proficiency in the skill. This bonus can change the outcome of the target's check.

name: Tireless Worker
details: You suppress your choice of one of the following conditions that's affecting the target: clumsy, encumbered, enfeebled, or fatigued. If you don't remove the effect that caused the condition, the condition returns after the spell's duration expires.

pf2t.name: Tireless Worker
pf2t.source: 148 Fires of the Haunted City pg. 65
pf2t.body:
**Duration** sustained for up to 1 minute
**Targets** 1 creature

- - -

You suppress your choice of one of the following conditions that's affecting the target: clumsy, encumbered, enfeebled, or fatigued. If you don't remove the effect that caused the condition, the condition returns after the spell's duration expires.

name: Electrified Crystal Ward
details: You create an electric latch rune hazard (Core Rulebook 523) on the target, creating a special crystalline lock on the object. You can also substitute your spell DC for any of the hazard's listed DCs. You can have only one such hazard active at a time, and if you cast this spell while a previous electric latch rune is active, the older hazard discharges harmlessly.

pf2t.name: Electrified Crystal Ward
pf2t.source: 148 Fires of the Haunted City pg. 75
pf2t.body:
**Targets** 1 hinge or latch

- - -

You create an electric latch rune hazard on the target, creating a special crystalline lock on the object. You can also substitute your spell DC for any of the hazard's listed DCs. You can have only one such hazard active at a time, and if you cast this spell while a previous electric latch rune is active, the older hazard discharges harmlessly.
- - -
**Heightened (+2)** The hazard's damage increases by 1d12.
